intro: Campanula azurea, commonly known as the blue bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are bell-shaped, typical of the Campanulaceae family, and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Campanula azurea prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes.
